copyright and are for personal non-commercial use only you may not edit sell or distribute this pattern or use it as a base to pass off as your own design pattern notes growing pumpkins is one of my highlights of the summer and harvesting them in autumn is even better these little munchkins are such a cute variety and are perfect for decorating the house before making their way to the oven this is a beginner-friendly pattern that s quick as well as easy to make it s worked in continuous rounds so you ll want to place a st marker at the beginning of each round to keeping track of your stitch count the pumpkin is then shaped and the stem is crocheted separately before attaching you ll also find a stitch guide included to help you with the particular stitches used throughout this pattern and to grow your amigurumi skills you could try making multiple pumpkins in a range of different autumnal shades or add some natural variation to the height by adding a few rounds of xs all round happy crocheting copyright © 2025 bilby & ben 3 instagram @bilbyandben the pattern and photographs of this design are the property of bilby & ben the pattern and design are subject to copyright and are for personal non-commercial use only you may not edit sell or distribute this pattern or use it as a base to pass off as your own design yarn & measurements the colours below are just suggestions and match the images in this pattern you can substitute your preference of colours i used hobbii yarn s rainbow bamboo for my pumpkins in the following colours orange ginger 21 dark green dusty pine 38 the left-hand column is how i refer to the colours throughout this pattern the right-hand column gives the name and number on the hobbii website you can of course use any other light dk weight yarn for this pattern but i highly recommend this lovely yarn for its softness colour palette and sheen you ll need minimal amounts of each colour so this pattern works great as a stash buster less than 40g 100m in total when complete your munchkin squash
